intro: Licania longipetala, commonly known as the long-petaled licania, is a climbing plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Peru. The plant is characterized by its elongated, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release small, hairy seeds upon maturity. Licania longipetala is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
